intro: Quercus ilex f. ambigua, commonly known as the Mediterranean holly oak, is a variant of the evergreen oak native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and small, glossy leaves that remain on the tree throughout the year. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers followed by acorns, which are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its hardy nature, it is a popular choice for ornamental landscaping in temperate climates.
